item.title: Where Winds Meet Gets Jam-Packed December 2025 Roadmap With New Region, Bosses, and More
item.content:encoded:
Where Winds Meet is the hottest new free-to-play game on the market as 2025 winds down, and developer Everstone Studio and publisher NetEase are ready for its popularity with a jam-packed month of updates for the game's December 2025 roadmap.

After hitting over 9 million players on PC and PS5, and more than 5 million pre-registrations for the mobile version, which is still to arrive on December 12, 2025, Everstone Studio is already adding huge chunks to the game, the big highlight being the addition of an entire new region for players to explore called Roaring Sands.

There are also new bosses to defeat, including a new campaign boss, and new limited-time activities for players to take advantage of.

The first week of additions, which includes the two new Jianghu Legacy quests, is already available at the time of this writing. The second week additions, which include the new River Master campaign boss and the big highlight of the Roaring Sands region, will arrive at the end of this week, alongside the game's launch on iOS and Android mobile devices.

The second new boss fight of the month, Feng Ruzhi, will arrive in the third week, alongside two limited-time activities. The final week offers the Scarlet Shock Sword Trial and Hero's Realm: Blade Dance activity, on top of a festively themed Fireworks Festival.

As post-launch content goes, it's clear that NetEase and Everstone have hit the ground running, ready to build off the momentum of the game's strong launch. If it can keep up its numbers now that millions of players have already stepped into its world, it could be the next Genshin Impact-level multiplayer action RPG.

For more on Where Winds Meet, check out Wccftech's review by Francesco De Meo, who gave the game an 8.5/10, writing, "Where Winds Meet delivers an exceptional open-world experience, successfully blending an engaging story, meaningful activities, a solid combat system paired with competent character progression, a wealth of multiplayer options, and one of the most lively cities in the genre. Though some of its features and mechanics suffer from the constraints of the free-to-play model, the good undeniably outweighs the bad, making it a rare title that can captivate even players who typically avoid similar open-world games, easily providing hundreds of hours of content even in its launch state."

You can also check out our guides, interviews with Everstone Studio, and all our coverage on Where Winds Meet at its hub page here.

item.title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre Almost At The Point When We Can Share More Information About It‚Äô: Will Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3 Be Announced at The Game Awards?
item.content:encoded:
The development of Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3 began even before the release of Final Fantasy VII Rebirth. Over the past year or so, director Naoki Hamaguchi teased how the experience, likely deeply rooted in the introduction of the Highwind airship, will be different from its predecessors while confirming that development was proceeding smoothly. And finally, we are nearing the point at which more information on the highly anticipated game can be shared, the first reportedly coming before the end of 2025.

Speaking in a new interview with Julien Chi√®ze, Hamaguchi-san commented on the current development state of the game, confirming that its experience is almost complete as the development team is focusing on fully fleshing out the experience.

"So, honestly, I want everyone to play it as soon as possible, but since it's a game, we must properly finish the detailed work, and only then can we deliver it to the users," Hamaguchi-san said in regards to when Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3 will launch. "So, after properly going through that [fleshing out] phase, we want to deliver it to everyone in a satisfactory form, so if you can just wait a little longer, I believe we will reach the stage where we can deliver various information to everyone," he added.

Speaking about the game's final name, Hamaguchi-san said that he and Tetsuya Nomura have "narrowed down" the options to two, and he expects the final choice to be made before the end of the year.

While it may be too early to see Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3 in action, the fact that we are nearing the point when more can be shared about it is definitely exciting. As for when this moment will arrive, it's not easy to say. Though unlikely if the game's name hasn't been finalized yet, if an announcement accompanied by the very first footage is coming before the end of the year, this week's The Game Awards would be the perfect occasion to begin the marketing cycle for one of the most anticipated JRPGs of the next few years.

Although Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3 won't see the light of day anytime soon, Nintendo Switch 2 and Xbox Series X|S owners who did not have the chance to play the Remake trilogy yet will finally get their chance next year, starting with Final Fantasy VII Remake Integrade, which launches this January on the Nintendo and Microsoft current-generation systems. The other two entries in the trilogy will also launch on both systems in the future.

item.title: No, That Shenmue 4 Footage Isn't Real, Developer Ys Net Says
item.content:encoded:
Shenmue studio Ys Net has taken to social media to debunk reports of a supposedly-leaked Shenmue 4 trailer, calling the footage's circulation a "serious issue".

Speaking on X (thanks, IGN), Ys Net said that the footage, which supposedly shows several scenes from a currently-in-development build of a fourth Shenmue game, has "absolutely no connection" to the studio.

Additionally, Ys Net says that it has "not released any trailers, footage, or other promotional materials related to Shenmue 4", and that the fact the footage uses the Ys Net logo "falsely giv[es] the impression that it is an official Shenmue 4-related video", which it is not.

Ys Net goes on to say that the use of its logo, as well as the attempt to mislead viewers into thinking the footage is official, "constitutes a serious issue that may amount to trademark infringement and unfair competition".

As such, the developer says it's "currently working with relevant parties and preparing appropriate measures, including potential legal action". It sounds like whoever made that footage might be dealing with some uncomfortable queries soon.

Although some believed the Shenmue 4 footage to be real, others suggested it had been made with generative AI, pointing to certain animations and the slightly-too-reverent story content in the trailer as proof.

Of course, being made with generative AI doesn't mean the trailer isn't real by itself; many studios, including EA, Netflix, and, indeed, Shenmue owner Sega, have embraced the technology in one form or another. Still, this particular Shenmue 4 balloon has been thoroughly popped, I'm afraid.

The Shenmue 4 footage doing the rounds might not be real, but that doesn't mean the franchise has no future. 

Back in August, Ys Net announced an enhanced version of Shenmue 3 for modern platforms, bringing improvements like camera tweaks, stamina adjustments, and skippable cutscenes.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign's Forsaken Hollows DLC Has Already Sold 2m Copies
item.content:encoded:
Bandai Namco and developer FromSoftware have revealed that Elden Ring Nightreign's The Forsaken Hollows DLC has already crossed a major sales milestone.

On the official Elden Ring X page, the two studios announced on Saturday that The Forsaken Hollows has sold two million copies across all platforms since its release last week.

At last count, Elden Ring Nightreign itself had sold around five million copies, so if that figure still stands, then that means more than a third of the game's players have picked up its DLC. Still, it's entirely possible the base game has racked up more sales for itself since July as well.

If you're not familiar with The Forsaken Hollows, it's the first big DLC expansion for Elden Ring Nightreign, and it introduces two brand new Nightlord bosses to take on, including the fearsome Dreglord.

As well as the two extra bosses, The Forsaken Hollows adds a new map (although it's technically just a Shifting Earth condition) to explore, plus new bosses from Souls series history, new enemies, and plenty more.

You can also play as two brand new characters in The Forsaken Hollows, namely the Scholar and the Undertaker, who bring disparate play styles to make your expeditions into the parallel land of Limveld more exciting.

As for the base game itself, Elden Ring Nightreign is an experimental spinoff of the multi-million-selling open-world Soulslike, one which mixes elements of games like Fortnite and extraction shooters into FromSoftware's signature blend of exploration and combat.

The game sees teams of up to three players heading into a constantly-changing map in order to scavenge gear, battle enemies and bosses to level up, and take on an especially powerful bespoke encounter at the conclusion of each three-day run.

You can check out Elden Ring Nightreign and its Forsaken Hollows DLC on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox right now, and you can read my review of the base game here.

item.title: Tekken Legend Katsuhiro Harada to Leave Bandai Namco
item.content:encoded:
Tekken director and industry icon Katsuhiro Harada has announced that he will leave Bandai Namco later this year.

In a message on social media, Harada says that while his experiences working on Tekken have "remained at the center of [his] identity", he's been thinking about "the time [he has] left as a creator".

These reflections were prompted by the loss of "several close friends" in Harada's personal life, as well as "the retirement or passing" of several colleagues whom Harada says he "deeply respect[s]".

Harada goes on to say that he's spent the last "four to five years" handing off responsibilities for Tekken to the franchise's development team, including the "stories and worldbuilding [he] oversaw", so his departure shouldn't come as too much of a shock for Tekken.

As for what's next for Harada, he says he'll "share more about [his] next steps at a later date". Could he be on his way to starting up his own studio, perhaps with NetEase funding? Recent developments may make that possibility a little more complicated than it might have been a year or two ago.

You haven't quite heard the last of Harada with regards to Tekken, though. He says that he will be attending the Tekken World Tour finals in January, albeit "as a guest", so you'll see him there if you check out that event.

Additionally, to say goodbye to Tekken, Harada has created a "DJ-style nonstop mix" of music from the franchise that he "personally edited". You can listen to it right here.

For its part, the Tekken team responded to Harada's departure on social media, expressing its "deepest gratitude" to him for his "vision", as well as the "continued success" of Tekken over the years.

It sounds as though Tekken will continue without Harada; the team says it's "fully committed to future development and content plans" for the latest game in the series. Stay tuned for more.

item.title: Fallout season 3 will start filming next summer if all goes plan, as its showrunners want to keep their big iron in the fire
item.content:encoded:
With season two about to debut, the plan's for the show to be back with more as soon as possible

They might not have committed to making any New Vegas ending the canon one, but the folks behind Amazon's Fallout TV show have been quick to decide they'd like to get started on filming a third series as soon as they can. Summer 2026, if all goes well, so the radioactive glow of the imminent second series hasn't totally faded to background levels by the time a follow-up drops.

So said executive producer Jonathan Nolan in a recent chat with the Ian Games Network.

"With regards to production, we're hoping to be shooting again next summer," the producer outlined. "We'll see if that all comes together, best laid plans and all." He then added: "I think what's happened with television in terms of taking longer and longer from season to season is an unfortunate trend. You don't want the show to lose any of its scope, but we know that we'd like to be back on the air as soon as we can."

Well, the conundrum outlined in that last bit sounds similiar to another medium, especially as the last couple of Fallout entries grow more and more distant in the rear view mirror.

As it is, I'm not surprised that having been given the green light earlier this year Fallout's showrunners are keen to keep pressing on while they've got momentum. It's not like they'll need time to decide the basics of where the third series will go either, having sketched out some stuff all the way up to a fifth or sixth season according to Maximus actor Aaron Moten.

I am interested to see which location's next on the road trip list of Lucy and co, with the series now having done arguably the two biggest stops on the non Bethesda-developed Fallout tour - California and Nevada. Maybe it'll be off to the Midwest for some Fallout: Tactics deep cuts.

I jest, but to be honest if the trend of revisiting locations is set to continue, it'd be nice to see an entry that isn't already given prominent billing given a bit of a spotlight. I mean, most of the gear and props will likely still be made to look Fallout 4-ish in the name of corporate synergy, but hey, I'm used to that by now.

item.title: Netflix Considered Buying EA and Disney
item.content:encoded:
A new report reveals that Netflix considered acquiring Electronic Arts, Disney, and Fox, but none of those deals came to fruition.

Netflix is the new big dog in town, ever since it announced that the company would acquire Warner Bros. for $82.7 billion in 2026, likely giving it access to studios like NetherRealm, Rocksteady, TT Games, and Avalanche. New details reveal they have considered buying other major companies, including EA and Disney.

Netflix ‚ÄòDebated Pursuing‚Äô EA, Disney, and Fox

A new Bloomberg report about Netflix CEO wooing Trump ahead of Warner Bros.‚Äô bid says the company considered acquisitions of EA, Disney, and Fox. It first talks about how Netflix is an ‚Äúunlikely bidder‚Äù, as co-founder and chairman, Reed Hastings, avoids major deals to build things ‚Äúfrom scratch‚Äù. The company‚Äôs management ‚Äúdebated pursuing just about every major asset put up for sale, including Electronic Arts Inc. and Fox.‚Äù They also considered acquiring Disney at one point.

However, the ‚Äúexecutives could never coalesce behind a deal.‚Äù Additionally, the execs didn‚Äôt want to ‚Äúhurt their stock price by overpaying for an asset that traded at a much lower multiple.‚Äù Netflix‚Äôs co-CEO Greg Peters also stated, ahead of the acquisition of Warner Bros., that ‚ÄúOne should have a reasonable amount of skepticism around big media mergers, they don‚Äôt have an amazing track record,‚Äù which led people to think Netflix was not interested in the deal.

In other news, here is every studio that was affected by the Warner Bros & Netflix merger. Additionally, Paramount has made a hostile offer to acquire Warner Bros. What are your thoughts on Netflix considering buying EA and Disney? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: System Shock Remake Coming To Switch 2 And Original Switch This Month
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nightdive Studios has announced that the System Shock remake will launch December 18 on Switch and Switch 2. The developer revealed that a critical decision regarding Unreal Engine made the ports possible, especially with the original Switch.

In a dev diary video on YouTube (seen below), Nightdive explains that the team first planned on utilizing Unreal Engine 5 for the remake of System Shock on Switch 2. But then Nightdive wondered about bringing the classic immersive to both Nintendo hybrid consoles and found out Unreal Engine 4 was a possibility. "Once we made that discovery, we did that big pivot for a few reasons--the biggest was stability," said developer Thomas Curnow.

Within 48 hours, Nightdive felt vindicated by the choice with Unreal Engine 4, according to the video. That's because successful builds of the remake were created for Switch and Switch 2 in that timeframe. "I want the game to be just as we remember it," said producer Justin Khan.

The System Shock remake first launched on PC in 2023 before arriving on PlayStation and Xbox consoles in May 2024. The efforts from Nightdive to resurrect the game were generally well received.

Earlier this year, Nightdive released a remaster of System Shock 2 on PC and consoles, including Switch. Nightdive is a part of Atari, after being acquired in 2023.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem leak points to a second playable character, and it isn't Leon
item.content:encoded:
A listing for Resident Evil Requiem's Deluxe Edition may have given away more than Capcom intended, with the suggestion of an unexpected playable character.

Ever since its announcement, players have speculated that Leon Kennedy would be popping up when Requiem debuts next year, but GameStop has unintentionally added another series name to the list of possible playable characters. Please be aware of potential Resident Evil Requiem spoilers below.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As spotted by social media account DuskGolem, the GameStop store page for Resident Evil Requiem's Deluxe Edition once featured exclusive content for none other than Rosemary Winters. She is the daughter of Resident Evil 7 and 8 protagonist, Ethan. And, while her inclusion has been scrubbed from the site now, the internet remembers.

As you can see in the image below, the Deluxe Edition initially promised users a Shadow Walker costume pack, which would include three outfits for Rosemary.

The same listing also mentioned two additional story scenarios, along with a "major" Mercenaries mode update and a Morphic Visor cosmetic filter for "Rose's visor" (oddly, they didn't say Rosemary here).

The wording has since been changed, and the GameStop listing for the Resident Evil Requiem Deluxe Edition now reads thus:

The Deluxe Kit contains the following content:

  • Five costumes including Grace's Costume: Dimitrescu
  • Two filters including Filter: Apocalypse
  • Four weapon skins including S&S M232 Weapon Skin: Apocalypse
  • Two charms including Charm: Mr. Raccoon
  • Audio Pack: Raccoon City Classic
  • Files: Letters from 1998

The last time we saw Rosemary Winters was in Resident Evil 8's Shadows of Rose DLC, where she appeared as a teenager with supernatural powers. In 2022, director Kento Kinoshita said Capcom was "creating the Shadows of Rose story to conclude the Winters family saga". So, was the studio calling our bluff?

There isn't too much longer to find out exactly what Resident Evil Requiem has in store for us, as it is due to be released across platforms on 27th February. Capcom has assured its Resi fans the team is working to ensure Resident Evil Requiem will perform well on PC, after a multitude of technical issues this year with Monster Hunter Wilds.

item.title: Award-Winning Slice-Of-Life Soccer Game 'Despelote' Comes To Switch This Week
item.content:encoded:
It's a goal!

One of the most unique a beautiful games of the year ‚Äî despelote ‚Äî is all about the beautiful game itself and the communities it helps build, and it's coming to Switch on 11th December in North America for just $14.99.

Japan will get it on 18th December, while the rest of the world will have to wait for kick-off on 13th January 2026.

despelote isn't your typical soccer game where you're kicking about a ball to win matches; this is a slice-of-life narrative-driven experience which is all about the importance of soccer to Ecuador and, in particular to eight-year-old Juli√°n, in the run up to the World Cup.

In despelote, you'll dribble, pass, and shoot the ball around Quito, but not for victory ‚Äî simply, to connect. How will people react? Will Ecuador qualify for the World Cup? And how does everyone feel about the beautiful game, of their city, their country?

It's a short game too, clocking in at around 2 hours, but from looking at reviews back when the game launched on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox in May, it'll stick with you long after. Here's a rundown of what toe expect from the game:

Features:

- A bittersweet and sometimes dreamy semi-autobiographical tale of youth.
- Explore a dense town space at your leisure, full of activities, interactions, and mischief to get up to.
- A physics-based soccer ball that feels good to kick around in a first-person perspective.
- A vibrant world full of characters that have funny, and genuine conversations.
- Photos and audio recorded on location in Ecuador are used to create a strong sense of place.

Have you been waiting to kick-off with despelote on Switch? Will you be scoring on 11th December? Let us know in the comments.

Alana has been with Nintendo Life since 2022, and while RPGs are her first love, Nintendo is a close second. She enjoys nothing more than overthinking battle strategies, characters, and stories. She also wishes she was a Sega air pirate.

item.title: EA Sports FC Led EU Sales Charts for Black Friday, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Stays Ahead of Battlefield 6
item.content:encoded:
A new report from The Game Business has, as it does each week, the latest GSD Sales Data for the top-selling games in the EU. This time, the weekly sales are from the week of November 24-30, which includes all of the Black Friday sales numbers, with EA Sports FC 26 winning the day in both sales by revenue and units sold. Meanwhile, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 was able to stay ahead of Battlefield 6.

In fairness, both of fall 2025's popular shooters were in the top five for the week, with Black Ops 7 riding its launch wave and Battlefield 6 getting put on a fairly significant Black Friday sale, though the discount wasn't enough to change the rankings from the week before, with Black Ops 7 still holding fast just above Battlefield 6.

Hogwarts Legacy was another notable entry in the charts. Even though it came in eighth place on the sales by revenue chart, it shot up all the way to second place in the units sold chart, beating Black Ops 7 and Battlefield 6. Red Dead Redemption 2 rounded out the top five units sold list, while on the revenue charts, after Battlefield 6 in third, Pok√©mon Legends Z-A and NBA 2K26 rounded out the top five in fourth and fifth place, respectively.

None of the entries in the revenue chart or units sold chart were brand new releases, with everyone taking advantage of Black Friday sales to pick up older games they had been eyeing. In fact, the most recent release on both charts was technically Black Ops 7, since it's the only game on either top ten list that released in November 2025.

Here's the list of the top ten best-selling games in the EU by units sold for the week of November 24-30, per The Game Business.

  1. EA Sports FC 26
  2. Hogwarts Legacy
  3. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  4. Battlefield 6
  5. Red Dead Redemption 2
  6. It Takes Two
  7. Grand Theft Auto V
  8. Pokemon Legends Z-A
  9. NBA 2K26
  10. F1 25

Here's the list of the top ten best-selling games in the EU by revenue for the week of November 24-30, per The Game Business.

  1. EA Sports FC 26
  2. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  3. Battlefield 6
  4. Pokemon Legends Z-A
  5. NBA 2K26
  6. F1 25
  7. Ghost of Yotei
  8. Hogwarts Legacy
  9. Marvel's Spider-Man 2
  10. Super Mario Galaxy 1 + 2

Elsewhere in The Game Business' report, on the hardware side of things per NielsenIQ, it was the PlayStation 5, not the Nintendo Switch 2, that was the hottest hardware item of the week. Not that the Switch 2 was a slouch, but significant discounts on the PS5 Pro and base PS5 models helped push it to be, according to The Game Business, the only console to actually improve on its sales numbers compared to last year.

Overall, not the most surprising Black Friday sales charts. Popular sports games and first-person shooters are at the top of the charts, with the rest of the list filled up by regulars on the charts like Rockstar's Grand Theft Auto V and Red Dead Redemption 2.

Though you do wonder if Microsoft continues to change how it delivers its games, particularly if it goes full-on into the Netflix-style distribution as former executive Peter Moore suggested, will Call of Duty or any other Microsoft-owned game still make these charts, or will the subscription-based focus leave a gap for other games to claim a spot as one of the regularly best-selling games week-to-week?

item.title: Beyond Skyrim: Cyrodiil introduces you to Anvil via a quest about child labour, a shirtless chase, and quick maths
item.content:encoded:
Also, a vaguely Hugh Hefner-inspired fishing magate called Franny

The modders behind Beyond Skyrim: Cyrodiil, the massive modding project aiming to add a post-Oblivion-crisis version of the Imperial province to the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim's map, have given a lengthy tour of the latest city they've whipped into shape. As teased the other week, that city is Anvil, and it's certainly home to some quirky folks.

Just in case of confusion, what makes Beyond Skyrim different to both Bethesda's Oblivion Remastered and recently delayed Oblivion remake mod Skyblivion is that it'll be introducing a fresh cast of characters and stories to familiar locations from the fourth Elder Scrolls game. After all, by the time of Skyrim, Martin Septim and his contemporaries are long gone.

Aside from the fact that existing Skyrim map expansion Beyond Skyrim: Bruma offers a great early taste of what this group of modders can pull off, what's intrigued me most so far is the project's mission to wind forward time and tell new tales. After all, Oblivion's a nice game to retread, but I've seen the narrative it has to offer plenty of times at this point.

However, having watched a good chunk of that livestream embedded above, where the Beyond Skyrim team show off some of the stories and characters they've worked into Anvil, my feelings are a bit mixed. The city itself looks brilliant, having been expanded and given an architectural feel which blends Cyrodiilic vibes with the deserty aesthetic of neighbouring province Hammerfell.

The layout still invokes plenty of nostalgia, while Beyond Skyrim's team look to have arguably leant more towards zany comedy with the side characters and quests who pop up to newcomers than the notoriously eccentric Oblivion did. Upon first entering the city, you come across and encounter with two drunken sailors swimming in the town's pod. A guard jumps in to arrest them, and these two loinclothed lads sprint off through the city; according to the devs, the idea is that you might pursue their nearly-bare bottoms and do some sightseeing. Or, maybe you'll move on and talk to an Argonian named Left-Hand who randomly demands you tell him what 4833 x 76 is.

Maelorn, an older version of one of the two elven twins you might remember from Oblivion, is less on the weird side, since he just asks you a riddle and then reminisces about his life since the days of The Elder Scrolls 4.

Anyway, what grabbed my attention the most was a quest involving a kid called Jinol, which kicks off in Anvil bazaar about half an hour in. It's simply called Child Labour, and is about, er, that. Jinol wants your help setting up a business selling saltwater from the docks door-to-door, so you recruit other kids to act as runners. So far, so quirky little quest in terms of premise. The idea's that you gradually realise that you maybe shouldn't just be going along with trying to make a buck off some kids doing work an adult should be doing, at least if the Elder Scrolls' world is being kept a bit more on the 'fantasy' side of the 'medieval fantasy' coin.

There is one character, a merchant named Pavia Tara, who calls you out and asks if you've considered the ethics of your actions. However, at the moment the modders seem to have reduced her to being a one-dimensional scolding Karen, even if she does weave a bit of small business vs big business chatter into her rant, mirroring the city's wider themes.

There's a spot of tonal whiplash there, alongside the quest's very on-the-nose name. Then, we meet Franny. Basically, you and Jinol go and meet the owner of a big fishing company, Francis of Anvil. He lives with multiple wives in a house the devs say was at least in part inspired by the Playboy mansion. Franny literally goes "Child labour, why didn't I think of that", and offers to buy out Jinol's business. You help the kid decide whether or not this grown, multiple-wife guy gets to save money by relying on child labour.

The quest is mostly played for laughs, and I certainly don't think the goal is to make light of what remains a real issue in our own world. Plus, the modders have aimed to make the kids essentially act like mini-adults. However, I'm not sure the quest strikes an effective balance between wacky/edgy humour, and making the player confront the morals behind what starts out as innocent fun.

As things go, it hasn't put me off Beyond Skyrim: Cyrodiil entirely ‚Äì I‚Äôm still keen to see what other sorts of tales the modders have weaved into their work. But it wouldn‚Äôt be the first time a mod has mishandled controversial or delicate themes in an attempt at crafting fresh narratives, and while Jinol‚Äôs water distribution service isn‚Äôt anywhere near the worst examples, it is something I hope gets revisited. Maybe when they go back to swap all the placeholder AI voices for real ones.

item.title: Stranger Things Fans Blame Netflix For The Bad Dialogue In Season 5
item.content:encoded:
Stranger Things‚Äô fifth and final season is rolling out on Netflix, and it‚Äôs true, something certainly seems stranger than in previous seasons this time around. Viewers of the long-running supernatural coming-of-age drama are arguing that the show‚Äôs writing has taken a massive nosedive, and even as someone who isn‚Äôt actively watching the series, I feel like some of the clips popping up on my social media feeds are not flattering. Fans think a Netflix initiative might be to blame.

Take, for example, these two clips of Noah Schnapp and Finn Wolfhard delivering extremely simple, flavorless dialogue with a seriousness and gravitas the language doesn‚Äôt earn. Some folks attribute the awkwardness of these scenes to the actors‚Äô performances, but others point out that it‚Äôs not just the self-serious delivery that‚Äôs the problem; it‚Äôs that it‚Äôs mixed with dialogue so straightforward that it reads like a mandated plot summary for those who haven‚Äôt been paying attention. 

This dumbing down of dialogue is just one part of the issue; some are also criticizing the uptick in obnoxious quip-driven writing. Some fans are quick to point out that teenagers might believably say cheesy stuff like the kids do in Stranger Things, however, so that‚Äôs more of an ongoing debate. The pushback hasn‚Äôt stopped people from making parodies of the latest season, likening its banter to cringe TikTok speak or MCUisms.

Fans have a theory that this decline in writing quality may have come from a Netflix mandate. In January, N+1 ran a story that detailed initiatives within the streaming company which told creatives to essentially treat the service‚Äôs original programming as if viewers are going to be on their phones scrolling through social media as they watch it. This means dialogue is dumbed down, basic plot points are repeated unnaturally in spoken exchanges, and ideally someone can follow what‚Äôs going on, even if the show doesn‚Äôt have their undivided attention.

It‚Äôs a real shame that Stranger Things might be falling into this trap in its final season, as fans have been waiting nearly a decade for this show to wrap up. Hopefully, the second set of episodes and the eventual finale will fare better when they‚Äôre released on Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve. Also, let‚Äôs hope that this doesn‚Äôt end up bleeding into all of the upcoming Warner Bros. projects if Netflix‚Äôs merger goes through.

item.title: First Player to Escape from Tarkov Gets Unique ‚ÄòStreamer Item‚Äô
item.content:encoded:
Tigz, who was documented last week as being the first person in the world to successfully escape from Tarkov, has been awarded a unique streamer item by Battlestate Games. These items are used to represent the respect that Battlestate Games has for the content creators who pour their lives into pulling Escape from Tarkov into the limelight time and again.

There are dozens of streamer items in the game, but the latest one belongs to Tigz, and it‚Äôs a tongue-in-cheek reference to the failed runs that prevented him from getting out of Tarkov without too many issues.

Tigz Has a Streamer Item

Tigz has a unique streamer item that‚Äôs reminiscent of his time spent escaping through Terminal, the final map in Battlestate Games‚Äô tough extraction shooter. In his first attempt, which was watched by tens of thousands of people, Tigz fell short of the ending after failing to find a splint to patch an injury that ultimately led to his death.

That forced him to try again, numerous times.

To honor and recognize that moment, Battlestate Games created a unique splint for Tigz‚Äôs streamer item ‚Äì Tigzresq. It‚Äôs a 67-inch splint in a red and black design that may or may not be practical. Streamer items are rarely practical, but if any will have an honest, in-game use, it‚Äôs the Tigzresq.

Another streamer item with a practical use is Gingy‚Äôs keychain, which does what you‚Äôd imagine and holds keys. There‚Äôs also WillerZ‚Äôs wallet, the RatCola, sprats, and a jar of mayo, amongst other things.

Whenever someone becomes big for streaming Escape from Tarkov, their streamer item is never too far behind. Fans of TheBurntPeanut, who recently won awards at The Streamer Awards, are clamouring for a unique item in Escape from Tarkov, given the amount of time the VTuber (sorry, PTuber) has spent in the game in recent years.

If you had a streamer item in Escape from Tarkov, what would it be? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: I Am Future coming to PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch on January 8, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Development team to announce new game on December 9.

Publisher tinyBuild and developer Mandragora will release cozy, single-player, post-apocalyptic survival simulation game I Am Future for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch on January 8, 2026 for $19.99, the companies announced.

Additionally, tinyBuild and Mandragora will unveil a new game from the I Am Future team during Wholesome Snack: The Game Awards 2025 Edition on December 9.

I Am Future first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on August 8, 2023, followed by a full release on November 13, 2024.

Here is an overview of the console release, via tinyBuild:

About

Console players will soon have the opportunity to build their own rooftop camp and relax in the aftermath of a catastrophic flood. Farming, fishing, exploring, crafting, cooking‚Äîwhat remains of the world is your oyster in I Am Future!

Console players will be able to enjoy all the content that was added to I Am Future throughout its journey on PC, from the initial debut in Steam Early Access in 2023 to the 1.0 launch in late 2024. These include a robust Story Mode, expanded base-building options, a complex weather system, relationship-building with other survivors, and much more. If games like Stardew Valley, DAVE THE DIVER, and Coral Island are up your alley, you‚Äôll feel right at home in I Am Future!

Key Features

  • Build the Cozy Rooftop Base of Your Dreams ‚Äì Starting from scratch on an abandoned rooftop, you‚Äôll build, decorate and expand the coziest camp ever! Unlock new buildings and furniture, set up electrical grids, and neatly organize your new life.
  • Relax in the Post-Apocalypse ‚Äì You are the last survivor on Earth, fresh from the sweet, long cryogenic sleep. It‚Äôs finally time to chill out and stop worrying about your job and inflation! Relax, build, wander around‚Äîthe world is literally yours!
  • Tend to Your Beautiful Farm ‚Äì Nature is healing! Set up a farm, grow fruit, vegetables, and trees, and take care of your crops!
  • Scavenge for Old-World Relics and Craft Gadgets ‚Äì Find ancient artifacts from a bygone era, like kettles, TVs, and microwaves, then take them apart with a satisfying dismantling system to gather resources for your next crafting project!
  • Hire a Team of Cute Robot Minions ‚Äì Automate chores around the camp with the help of cute robots! Build a team of AI assistants, issue commands, and manage their workload. And when they‚Äôre done‚Äîlet them chill in a charging bath!
  • Explore a Mysterious World ‚Äì Send out scouting drones on expeditions across the sunken megapolis. Discover new locations, bring something valuable back to base, and uncover the mystery behind the end of the world step by step.
  • Make New Wonderful Friends ‚Äì The fact that you‚Äôre the last human on Earth doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt still make new friends! Meet quirky robot inhabitants of this new world, like Earl the Fridge or Bombshell Barbara, and grow your bond with them.
  • Protect Your Base From Pesky Pests ‚Äì Your camp needs love and protection. Keep pesky mutant pests from destroying the crops or the electrical grid!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Kingdom of Gaming event to debut in Saudi Arabia with state backing
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr, Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

December 8, 2025

2 Min Read

Saudi Arabia will play host to a new video game conference next year that has been organized, in part, by an investment fund established by the region's controversial ruler, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

The event has been dubbed Kingdom of Gaming and will take place in Riyadh from December 1 to December 3, 2026. 

"Kingdom of Gaming will serve as a global platform, connecting the developers, studios, and investors who are shaping what the world will play next. It will accelerate the growth of a world-class game creation ecosystem in Saudi Arabia and across the Global South," reads a press release. 

The inaugural event will be co-located with Black Hat MEA 2026 (a global cybersecurity conference) and purportedly welcome over 20,000 guests, 300 exhibitors and sponsors, and 500 participating studios and developers

Kingdom of Gaming is being launched by Tahaluf, a joint venture between GDC (and Game Developer) parent company Informa; the Saudi Federation for Cybersecurity, Programming and Drones; and the Events Investment Fund (EIF). 

Sela, the event production company owned by Saudi Arabia's sovereign Public Investment Fund (PIF), is also set to join the venture. 

The EIF was launched in 2023 by Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who is the de-facto ruler of Saudi Arabia and chairman of PIF‚Äîwhich is currently attempting to take EA private for $55 billion as part of a investor consortium. 

Related:Tekken boss Katsuhiro Harada is leaving Bandai Namco

PIF will own 93.4 percent of the U.S. based Battlefield publisher if the deal is approved. 

Saudi Arabia's aggressive investment into the video game industry has drawn criticism due to bin Salman's widely-reported links to the murder of The Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi (via The BBC) and accusations of human rights abuses within the country. 

Game Developer has reached out to Tahaluf for comment.  

Game Developer and Tahaluf are sibling organizations under Informa.

About the Author

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Game Developer news editor Chris Kerr is an award-winning reporter with over a decade of experience in the game industry. His byline has appeared in notable print and digital publications including Edge, Stuff, Wireframe, International Business Times, and PocketGamer.biz. Throughout his career, Chris has covered major industry events including GDC, PAX Australia, Gamescom, Paris Games Week, and Develop Brighton. 



https://www.gamedeveloper.com/business/kingdom-of-gaming-event-to-debut-in-saudi-arabia-with-state-backing

item.title: "My Staff Have Had Customers Threatening To Rip Their Heads Off" - Retailers And Collectors Tell Of Pok√©mon TCG Woes
item.content:encoded:
"Scalpers are making it impossible to find cards"

The fact that the Pok√©mon Trading Card Game has created its own mini-economy isn't new news ‚Äì back when it launched in the late '90s, there were accusations that it was encouraging gambling amongst kids, with many schools banning the cards from their playgrounds.

In more recent years, however, the market for collectable cards has risen to hitherto unseen levels of insanity, driven by the fact that the children who grew up with Pok√©mon in the '90s and 2000s are now adults and can invest heavily in picking up the rarest examples ‚Äì and the high prices have predictably encouraged in opportuniustic scalpers moving in, drawn by the promise of turning small purchases into hundreds of dollars.

The end result, rather sadly, is that younger Pok√©mon fans are being denied the chance to grab cards for themselves.

British news outlet The Guardian has been speaking to retailers and fans to get their take on the current state of the Pok√©mon Trading Card Game in the UK, and it's not particularly pleasant reading.

Ben Thyer, the owner of the independent store BathTCG, says:

"My staff have had customers threatening to come back and rip their heads off. It‚Äôs become quite unpleasant at times. I‚Äôve heard of other stores where people have been attacked or there have been robberies. We‚Äôve even seen people who buy our products and list them immediately on Facebook, while still in our carrier bags, or sell it right outside the shop. We‚Äôre even anxious to put stuff on the shelf for the public because we just don‚Äôt want to entice that sort of behaviour. We used to sell whole boxes of booster packs but now we‚Äôve had to stop doing that, and even place limits on the individual packs."

Demand has consistently outstripped supply in the world of Pok√©mon TCG for a few years now, but Thyer thinks a correction is perhaps on the way ‚Äì although it may not last for very long:

"There are signs of the market cracking ‚Äì prices of singles are coming down, sealed products are coming down. People aren‚Äôt as ferocious as they once were. There‚Äôs also a lot of people now thinking, ‚ÄòChristmas is soon and I need some money because I‚Äôve not made what I was hoping for [from reselling cards]‚Äô. So we‚Äôll see it dip, but then early 2026 brings Pok√©mon‚Äôs 30th anniversary, so I think we‚Äôll see another crazy period."

[source theguardian.com]

Damien has been writing professionally about tech and video games since 2007 and oversees all of Hookshot Media's sites from an editorial perspective. He's also the editor of Time Extension, the network's newest site, which ‚Äì paradoxically ‚Äì is all about gaming's past glories.

  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: ‚ÄòI Don‚Äôt Know if This Will Work Out‚Äô: Hideo Kojima Comments on The Challenges OD Will Face
item.content:encoded:
Hideo Kojima is no stranger to creating unique experiences that challenge established gameplay formulas. With the Death Stranding series, the legendary creator of the Metal Gear Solid series has created open-world experiences that are markedly different from anything else on the market, transforming a desolate post-apocalyptic world into the perfect setting for players to form meaningful bonds through gameplay. With the horror game OD, however, it sounds like the legendary creator will push video game boundaries even further, as he isn't sure the experience will work out in the end.

As translated by Automaton, Kojima-san recently talked about OD and the challenges the game will face in a new interview with ananweb. "I can‚Äôt say exactly what it is yet, nor do I know if it will work out. We‚Äôve created stealth games and delivery games which were unlike anything before, but system-wise, they were similar to other games. This time, we‚Äôre trying to change the service model from the ground up, so it should be quite challenging," Kojima-san said.

While we still don't know exactly how OD will play, according to Hideo Kojima, there's already a way to understand the experience better. "We‚Äôve packed the trailer full of hints, so if you keep thinking about it, you might figure it out."

I, for one, am not ashamed to admit I haven't any clue about the game as much as anyone else. However, OD being so different from anything else is making me quite excited about what it will offer over traditional horror games, which deserve a major shake-up since they haven't really moved past the experience established by the Resident Evil series in any significant way.

As for when we will be able to understand more about OD, no one can say. With Hideo Kojima having released Death Stranding 2: On the Beach this year (and with a PC port likely getting announced during this year's The Game Awards), it may be a while until the studio is ready to unveil a project that sounds more promising by the day.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.

item.title: This Dell Laptop Used to Cost Several Times More Than a MacBook, Now It‚Äôs 70% Off and Cheaper Than One
item.content:encoded:
Dell makes some of our favorite laptops out there, and if you‚Äôre a student or a work professional looking to grab a solid option without shelling out big bucks, Amazon is making that possible today.

The 15-inch Dell Inspiron laptop, which typically sits at a not-so-friendly price of $2,400, is sitting at just $760 at the retailer, after a massive 68% discount ‚Äì the lowest we have seen it drop to in 30 days. You‚Äôre even getting a whole bunch of useful accessories, plus Windows 11 Pro pre-installed with your purchase, for absolutely nothing to sweeten the deal even more. We‚Äôre expecting it to be a popular pick this holiday season, so you might want to grab it before the stock starts thinning out.

See at Amazon

Massive Memory, Spacious Storage

For under $800, you‚Äôre getting a 15.6-inch Full HD IPS touchscreen that delivers vibrant, immersive, true-to-life visuals consistently, whether you‚Äôre catching up on the latest episode of your favorite show or creating a work presentation. The anti-glare panel helps you fight reflections in brighter settings, while the Dell ComfortView software actively reduces harmful blue light to minimize eye strain during those all-nighters. Touch support makes navigation a breeze by letting you use just your fingers to pinch, scroll, swipe, zoom, and more directly on the screen. It comes in handy when you‚Äôre working through longer documents and don‚Äôt want to rely on the trackpad or the mouse to scroll, or when sharing the laptop with a friend and both of you need to access the screen or work on something together. Note that the screen does not fold all the way back as it does in 2-in-1 laptops, so this doesn‚Äôt exactly give you that tablet-like functionality.

The screen is paired with a full-sized keyboard that features a lift hinge design to keep your wrists comfortable while typing. Video calls are made easy with the built-in HD webcam that offers noise reduction for a clearer picture, even in low-light settings.

For power, Dell offers an Intel 13th Gen Core i5-1334U processor with 10 cores, 12 threads, and intelligent boost speeds up to 4.6 GHz. It‚Äôs more than capable of handling all your everyday work and play tasks, plus some resource-intensive creative projects with ease. The massive 32GB of DDR4 RAM keeps the system running fast and smoothly, even when you‚Äôre trying to do multiple jobs at the same time. It‚Äôs excellent for demanding tasks like 4K video editing, running virtual machines, and even gaming with some apps running in the background.

Creatives and work professionals will also appreciate the 1 TB PCIe NVMe SSD that not just offers sufficient space to house all your data, but also ensures better boot times, quick file access, and faster file transfers. Basically, the processor, memory, and SSD come together to ensure a lag-free, smooth experience during both regular and demanding days. Connectivity-wise, you‚Äôre covered with the ultra-fast WiFi 6, Bluetooth, plus a wide range of ports like USB-C, USB 3.2, HDMI, and an SD card reader.

The freebies include Windows 11 Pro pre-installed, a mouse, a 7-in-1 cleaning kit, a 128GB UFD, and a docking station. That‚Äôs everything you need to get started with work or play right away. Just note that drops this massive are only around for a short period of time before the stock runs out or the deal expires. If you‚Äôve been after a reliable laptop that doesn‚Äôt blow your budget, this is it.

item.title: Paramount Ready To Spend $108 Billion On Hostile Takeover Of Warner Bros. To Stop Netflix From Having It
item.content:encoded:
We knew Paramount Skydance wanted to buy Warner Bros. Discovery. We knew that they company was pretty pissed when Warner CEO David Zaslav turned down the offer for $20 a share for the entire company. And we knew that this became a fury when Netflix and Warner agreed to a deal at $27.5 per share last week. Now Paramount has reacted, and reacted big. The company has launched a hostile takeover bid, swooping in with a $30 per share offer, which works out to over $108 billion, $25 billion more than Netflix is paying.

It was rumored earlier this year, while Zaslav was making it clear how much he wanted to sell Warner Discovery, that he was looking for $30 per share‚Äîa massive over-valuation of the company, but one he was looking to justify by splitting the company, severing off the ‚ÄúDiscovery‚Äù parts and its loss-making cable networks, and loading that doomed company with all of Warner‚Äôs debts. Paramount‚Äôs opening bid at $20, however, was for the whole shebang. Netflix, however, outbid everyone by agreeing to $27.5 per share after the split, which is due to happen in the second half of 2026.

Now, Paramount is going hard in its efforts to prevent this, increasing its previous offer by an enormous 50 percent, and again for the whole company and all its debt. The BBC reports that the company, backed by the billionaire Ellison family, called this bid a ‚Äúsuperior alternative,‚Äù and clearly one designed to make shareholders revolt if Warner sticks with Netflix‚Äôs lower offer.

This was never likely to go smoothly. If the Netflix deal goes through, it would make the streamer one of the most powerful players in Hollywood, and with the absorption of HBO Max an even more dominant force in streaming. Regulators were absolutely going to be scrutinizing this, and in a time when such bodies are now fully under the control of president Donald Trump‚Äôs mercurial (and self-interested) whims, that could go in any direction. Things were looking positive for Netflix in this regard, after its CEO Ted Sarandos had recently been to the Oval Office, likely to play on the president‚Äôs infantile habit of agreeing with the last confident voice that spoke to him. However, Sunday night Trump gave hints that he was going to be a wrench in the works, saying the deal ‚Äúcould be a problem.‚Äù

It‚Äôs also worth noting that the recent Paramount and Skydance merger only took place after the company, er, ‚Äúsettled‚Äù a legal dispute with Trump by giving him $16 million.

Paramount‚Äôs offer would work out to $108.4 billion for the whole company, including its cable networks, dwarfing Netflix‚Äôs post-debt removal offer of $83 billion. Warner Bros. Discovery isn‚Äôt worth close to either figure‚Äîoptimistically valued at around $10 a share six months ago, and Paramount itself is only worth $11 billion in its own right. Larry Ellison, who backs the company, is said to be worth nearly $270 billion, so could certainly afford it, but it‚Äôd still be the most extraordinary outlay were there to be no external investors involved. As more details come to light from Axios reporter Sara Fischer, it seems that‚Äîinevitably‚Äîa lot of the money will come from wealth funds including Saudi Arabia‚Äôs, Qatar‚Äôs and the UAE‚Äôs, among others.

üö®üö® WOW. Paramount's initial press statement didn't include a mention of sov wealth funds, but sep SEC filing said other outside financing partners include funds from Saudis, Qataris, Emirates as well as Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners (!)
Those funders, "have agreed to forgo‚Ä¶ https://t.co/5kkhRQWHx4

‚Äî Sara Fischer (@sarafischer) December 8, 2025

The New York Times‚Äò Lauren Hirsch further details the figures, stating that $24 billion of the total will be sourced this way, with a further billion from Tencent, and then a bunch from RedBird Capital Partners and Trump‚Äôs son-in-law Jared Kushner‚Äôs Affinity Partners. Kushner‚Äôs involvement could explain Trump‚Äôs intervention over the weekend.

Paramount‚Äôs bid for WBD is backed in part by
‚Äì $24bn from Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds
‚Äì $1bn from China‚Äôs Tencent
‚Äì Jared Kushner‚Äôs private equity firm pic.twitter.com/Kdt94WevPc

‚Äî Lauren Hirsch (@LaurenSHirsch) December 8, 2025

So, there we are, more excitement in the world of billionaires buying up everything to feed us their homogenized sludge.

Updated: 12/08/2025, 11:17 a.m. ET: Updated the post to add details about Paramount‚Äôs potential investors in the deal.



https://kotaku.com/netflix-warner-paramount-trump-bidding-war-2000651372

item.title: Saros Has Been Rated in Taiwan, Pre-Orders Expected Imminently
item.content:encoded:
Saros rating has appeared in Taiwan for the title‚Äôs standard and deluxe editions, suggesting pre-orders are imminent.

Housemarque‚Äôs Saros is one of the most anticipated titles of 2026 and also the next PlayStation exclusive from the studio after Returnal. We have already seen some gameplay and have a release date for Saros as well; all players are waiting for now is for pre-orders to open.

Saros Rating Appears in Taiwan

Spotted by Gematsu on X (formerly Twitter), Saros‚Äôs standard and digital deluxe editions have been rated in Taiwan. Both versions have been rated ‚ÄòPG-15‚Äô and contain violence and shooting according to the rating. Many players think that with the game‚Äôs rating surfacing now, a pre-order announcement could arrive soon; however, there is no official word from the developers. Interestingly, the rating has appeared very close to The Game Awards 2025, so could we expect an announcement there? Also, could Saros be the game behind the mysterious statue?

For those unaware, Saros is an upcoming sci-fi adventure that has players taking on the role of Arjun Devraj, a Soltari enforcer who will stop at nothing to pursue answers on the shape-shifting world of Carcosa. The title features a constantly evolving world, and you will need to find permanent resources to ensure it yields for you. It also features a high-tech arsenal of weapons, which has players dodging, shielding, and parrying enemy attacks in a ‚Äúfluid, flow-state-inducing dance.‚Äù

In other news, check out Saros‚Äôs latest gameplay trailer, revealed during September‚Äôs State of Play event. Do you think Saros‚Äô rating in Taiwan suggests pre-orders will start soon? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3‚Äôs game experience being almost complete. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Paramount Reveals Hostile Offer for Warner Bros Worth $18 Billion More
item.content:encoded:
Last week, Netflix revealed an $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery and carve out a monumental corner of the media streaming empire. Now, Paramount has clapped back with a hostile bid, slamming Netflix and claiming that it had offered an ‚Äòinferior proposal‚Äô for WBD.

Paramount‚Äôs representatives have promised a tender offer of $30 per share, compared to Netflix‚Äôs $27.75 offer. It‚Äôs also a bid to avoid splitting up Warner Bros. Discovery, which is what the Netflix acquisition would do. If Paramount is successful, it‚Äôll acquire WBD in its entirety.

Will Paramount or Netflix Buy Warner Bros. Discovery?

In a post from The Hollywood Reporter, it was confirmed that Paramount had filed a hostile proposal in the wake of Netflix‚Äôs revelation in the WBD arena. In a statement, David Ellison, the CEO of Paramount, explained:

WBD shareholders deserve an opportunity to consider our superior all-cash offer for their shares in the entire company.

Our public offer, which is on the same terms we provided to the Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors in private, provides superior value, and a more certain and quicker path to completion. We believe the WBD Board of Directors is pursuing an inferior proposal which exposes shareholders to a mix of cash and stock, an uncertain future trading value of the Global Networks linear cable business and a challenging regulatory approval process.

We are taking our offer directly to shareholders to give them the opportunity to act in their own best interests and maximize the value of their shares.

The Hollywood Reporter anticipates a lengthy process to follow, with Paramount and Netflix lobbying and counter-lobbying for the acquisition rights of Warner Bros. Discovery.

In a strange twist, it was later revealed that Paramount published a website dubbed ‚ÄòStrongerHollywood‚Äô, aimed at rubbing Netflix the wrong way and proving that Paramount‚Äôs offer is much more worthwhile for the wider industry.

Whichever media titan is successful, they‚Äôll gain ownership of Warner Bros.‚Äô gaming studios, including the likes of Avalanche, NetherRealm, Rocksteady, and TT Games, as well as the WB Games branches.

What are your predictions regarding the Warner Bros. Discovery buyout? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Assassin‚Äôs Creed Games Will Feature More Parkour & Possibly ‚ÄòDual-Protagonists‚Äô Again
item.content:encoded:
A fascinating interview with Assassin‚Äôs Creed game director Simon Lemay-Comtois has revealed that the team is eager to learn from past mistakes and oversights for future Assassin‚Äôs Creed games, such as a lack of parkour focus.

Assassin‚Äôs Creed Shadows was a financial and critical success. It may not go down as peak AC, but it‚Äôs a solid return to form. Shadows, in particular, and its post-launch content are looking to bring back a classic gameplay tradition, and have spoken about the use of dual-player mechanics in additional releases down the line.

Future Assassin‚Äôs Creed Games Will Learn From Mistakes

An Insider Gaming exclusive revealed further details on the Assassin‚Äôs Creed Roadmap and what games to expect. There is clearly a long road ahead for the franchise, and Shadows was the latest mainline release.

Shadows game director Simon Lemay-Comtois told GamesRadar that the current release and future AC games should focus on one gameplay mechanic that‚Äôs been missing:

‚ÄúPay more attention to parkour in future games as its own pillar. We‚Äôre trying to rectify that in post-launch with Shadows and push that narrative internally to say, parkour matters. Let‚Äôs really push parkour forward.‚Äù

Old-school AC fans will remember scaling towns and cities across Italy, whereas recent games have placed less emphasis on verticality in favor of grander open-world design and combat.

There‚Äôs still an inherent desire for the basics of Assassin‚Äôs Creed roots. Speaking of which, another newer addition (opposing convention) in the last few years has been the incorporation of dual-player stories.

Lemay-Comtois has indicated that the system won‚Äôt be going away if it makes sense for the project:

‚ÄúDual protagonists can be divisive along very strange lines, right? It‚Äôs not just a ‚Äòwell, I prefer a war, therefore I prefer Yasuke.‚Äô Some people just don‚Äôt like one character over the other, and they don‚Äôt like to spend time with one. It was true with Evie and Jacob, but with Naoe and Yasuke it‚Äôs more divisive. And we knew this. We knew going into it, but I think it can split our fan base a little too.

I think the learning for us is that, yes, we could do more dual-protagonist games in the future ‚Äì if we have a good reason to do it narratively and for the setting.‚Äù

We know that the Assassin‚Äôs Creed IV: Black Flag Remake won‚Äôt be using two-player mechanics, and parkour will be very much part of its DNA. What do you want to see from future Assassin‚Äôs Creed games? Now‚Äôs your chance to tell the world through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Also, read about Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3‚Äôs Game Experience Being ‚ÄòMore or Less Complete,‚Äô and Tekken Director Katsuhiro Harada Leaving Bandai Namco After 30 Years.

item.title: Shenmue Studio Considering Legal Action Over Fake Shenmue 4 Trailer
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you saw the Shenmue 4 trailer that went viral recently and were hoping it was leading to an announcement, then you're going to be disappointed. Ys Net, the studio founded by Shenmue creator Yu Suzuki, has issued a statement condemning the trailer as a fake while also hinting that it may take legal action against the trailer's creator.

In a post on social media, Ys Net said the fake Shenmue 4 trailer "uses our company logo without permission, falsely giving the impression that is an official Shenmue 4 related video produced by us." The statement adds that there have been no official Shenmue 4 materials released, and that the studio is "currently working with relevant parties and preparing appropriate measures, including potential legal action" against the creator of the trailer.

The original Shenmue was released in 1999 on Sega Dreamcast, and it cast players as a young man, Ryo Hazuki, as he sought to avenge his father's death. The game had innovative takes on open-world gameplay and quicktime events that proved to be very influential in the video game industry. Shenmue 2 followed in 2001, but the franchise went on hiatus due to low sales.

Following Suzuki's departure from Sega, Shenmue 3 was successfully crowdfunded and released in 2019. Earlier this year, Inin Games and Suzuki announced that Shenmue 3 Enhanced will be coming to PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and Nintendo consoles. That version of the game will feature numerous visual upgrades including 4K texture uplift for the environments and characters. It will also feature increased density of NPC characters in the streets to make the game world feel more alive.

Last year, a group of dedicated Shenmue fans launched a campaign for Shenmue 4 by purchasing a Times Square ad in New York. It remains to be seen if that campaign will ultimately lead to the franchise getting a new sequel.

item.title: Don't Expect A New Dead Space Game Anytime Soon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Dead Space franchise is reportedly "on ice" at EA. And no, we're not referring to the frozen planet of Tau Volantis, the setting for Dead Space 3. Basically, there are no plans for a new sequel, remake, or even reboot of the survival-horror franchise.

Insider Gaming states that EA sources have informed them about the latest Dead Space direction--or lack of direction, in this case. In early 2023, a remake of Dead Space was released, making people speculate about a new sequel or future remakes. But instead, there reportedly won't be any sort of followup anytime soon. GameSpot has reached out to EA for comment.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: The Complete DEAD SPACE Timeline Explained!

The report adds that the same sources hope the company might sell the Dead Space franchise after EA sold itself for $55 billion to Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners, and the private equity firm Silver Lake. The deal could lead to $20 billion in debt. As such, there's speculation EA could auction off Dead Space to help pay off that gigantic amount. But that raises questions: What company would want to acquire Dead Space? And would the sum be even a drop in the bucket against $20 billion?

In October, Dead Space co-creator Glen Schofield revealed that he's made calls about the series. Schofield claims he can save EA up to $40 million on the idea he has for Dead Space. In addition, Schofield--whose background includes The Callisto Protocol and Call of Duty: WWII--believes EA could sell the franchise, too, as he believes it's a prime candidate for a TV show or movie.

The latest place that Dead Space popped up was with a controversial bundle in the free-to-play Skate. The roughly $35 add-on included a cardboard-style Isaac Clarke costume, a themed skateboard, and Necro Stomp emote.
